Posts.Content: boobonics wrote: I am a 6 yr survivor who was dx'd with Lymphedema 3 yrs ago.  I only have issues occasionally but have been flying and stressing my hand/arm.  Thursday I noticed my hand was hurting-so began MLD and began wearing my compression sleeve and glove.  My hand swelled, its still a little swollen but I can see my knuckles.  I fly today and will get my shower out of the way so I can sleeve/glove up.   I really think one of my biggest culprits was hydration-soon as I realized I was not drinking enough water...but it was too late.  I am now hydrating religiously. Thanks for letting my know I am not alone in this battle. Deb Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: I can see my knuckles again! boobonics boobonics

Posts.Content: Jul 29, 2009 12:03AM boobonics wrote: ThaInks yall. I am having to learn all new rules.  My life as I knew it, is changing and will involve travelling.  I do pack on the bed.  When I can I will spread packing out, but sometimes its throw and go-with clean clothes.  last weekend I did not even have 48 hours at home between trips. I will wear my sleeve and glove this next weekend when I pack..  I appreciate all the tips.  Deb
Posts.Title: I can see my knuckles again! boobonics boobonics
